alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 7:55AM CST until February 25 at 2:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River At Franklin affecting Williamson County. For the Harpeth River...including Franklin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Harpeth River At Franklin. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Water begins to inundate low lying areas along the banks, including the nursery at Hillsboro Road and Fulton Greer Lane. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 23.1 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 7.3 feet Tuesday evening. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 200 PM CST.
